name: How to compile, write, and use CFD libraries in C++
description: Learn how to use libraries/dependencies in C++. We look at how to compile, write, and ultimately use libraries, focusing in particular on CFD applications.

01_understanding-static-dynamic-and-head.heading: Understanding static, dynamic, and header-only C++ libraries
01_understanding-static-dynamic-and-head.description: Libraries/dependencies are a powerful tool in C++. Written by C++ experts, we get functionality and speed for free. Learn how to leverage them for your code.

02_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-discretisi.heading: How to write a CFD library: Discretising the model equation
02_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-discretisi.description: Learn how to discretise the heat diffusion equation with the finite volume method and how to discretise it using explicit and implicit time integrations.

03_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-basic-libr.heading: How to write a CFD library: Basic library structure
03_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-basic-libr.description: Don't know how to structure a library and how to test it? Learn how to do just that along with scripts to compile your library on Windows, Linux, and macOS.

04_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-the-conjug.heading: How to write a CFD library: The Conjugate Gradient class
04_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-the-conjug.description: Learn how to implement the conjugate gradient algorithm to solve the linear system of equations (Ax=b) for Computational Fluid Dynamics applications.

05_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-the-vector.heading: How to write a CFD library: The vector class
05_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-the-vector.description: The vector class is a fundamental building block in our linear system of equations solver library and we'll explore in this article how to implement it.

06_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-the-sparse.heading: How to write a CFD library: The sparse matrix class
06_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-the-sparse.description: Learn the compressed sparse row (CSR) matrix storage format in this article and how to code it in C++ for Computational Fluid Dynamics applications.

07_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-compiling-.heading: How to write a CFD library: Compiling and testing
07_how-to-write-a-cfd-library-compiling-.description: Learn how to compile library code into static and dynamic libraries on UNIX and Windows, as well as how to turn libraries into header-only libraries.

08_how-to-integrate-external-cfd-librari.heading: How to integrate external CFD libraries in your code
08_how-to-integrate-external-cfd-librari.description: Learn how to use Make, Ninja, CMake, Meson, Autotools and MSBuild to compile your own and third-party CFD libraries from source for cross-platform development.

09_how-to-handle-c++-libraries-with-a-pa.heading: How to handle C++ libraries with a package manager
09_how-to-handle-c++-libraries-with-a-pa.description: Learn how to compile and manage CFD libraries automatically using the Conan C++ package manager, and why you should stay away from Microsoft's vcpkg tool.
